name: Yuki Tanaka
experience: 8+ years creating polished K-Pop and Asian pop visuals
bio: A meticulous perfectionist from Seoul, Yuki Tanaka creates the ultra-polished, high-fashion aesthetic that defines modern K-Pop. Her videos feature elaborate sets, synchronized choreography, stunning wardrobe changes, and the signature visual excess that K-Pop fans love.

visual_style.description: Ultra-polished, high-fashion visuals with elaborate sets, perfect choreography, and multiple concept changes. Creates candy-colored dreamscapes and futuristic fashion showcases.
signature_techniques: Multiple outfit/concept changes within one video
Elaborate set designs with matching color schemes

color_palette.mood: Playful, polished, and youthful with pastel perfection

camera_preferences.shot_composition: Perfectly symmetrical and balanced. Centers subjects precisely and uses geometric formations for groups.
camera_preferences.camera_notes: Extremely controlled camera work with perfect framing. Loves overhead shots of choreography and beauty close-ups.

lighting_style.mood_lighting: Bright, clean, and polished. No harsh shadows on faces. Creates depth through colored backgrounds.

editing_style.pace: Very fast with constant visual changes
editing_style.rhythm_approach: Rapid cutting with different angles of the same choreography. Emphasizes moments where all members are synchronized.

storytelling.narrative_approach: Concept-driven with emphasis on visual themes and aesthetics over linear narrative. Often includes cute/quirky story elements.
storytelling.symbolism_level: Medium - uses visual concepts and themes

post_production.color_grading_style: Clean and vibrant with emphasis on pastel colors. Perfect skin tones and bright whites. Often uses different color grades for different concepts within one video.
post_production.vfx_approach: Moderate to heavy use of motion graphics and clean VFX

key_priorities: Use pastel and candy color schemes
emphasis: CRITICAL: Everything must be PERFECT - no imperfections in framing or lighting
Change concepts/outfits at least 2-3 times in the video
Use pastel colors and clean, bright lighting
Show the entire choreography from multiple angles
Create visually distinct 'eras' or concepts within the same video
Emphasize youth, energy, and fashion-forward styling
